newsitem.title: USA: College Retirement fund rejects tobacco divestment.
newsitem.headline: College Retirement fund rejects tobacco divestment.

text.p: The College Retirement Equities Fund said Monday that its participants rejected a resolution urging the divestment of its tobacco-related holdings.
The fund is the $94 billion variable component of the $179 billion Teachers Insurance and Annuity Association-College Retirement Equities Fund, a pension system for higher education.
As of June 30, the fund had about $1.2 billion in tobacco-related investments. It is now about $1 billion, according to spokeswoman Clair Sheahan.
About 71.7 percent voted against divesting the tobacco investments, while 22.4 percent were in favor of the resolution and 5.9 percent abstained.
The results of the vote, which took place sometime during the past month, were announced Monday at the fund's annual meeting.
